Tea (verbena tea is a popular herbal tea that is made by infusing the leaves and flowers of the plant in hot water)
Ice cream (Verbena officinalis is sometimes used as a flavorings in ice cream, particularly in Italian and Mexican-inspired flavors)
Jelly (verbena jelly is made by boiling the leaves and flowers of the plant with sugar and pectin to create a sweet, gelatinous spread)
Cakes (Verbena officinalis can be used in cake recipes as a substitute for or in addition to traditional flour, adding a subtle flavor and texture)
Sauces (verbena sauce is made by reducing the plant's flowers and leaves with vinegar or wine to create a sweet and tangy sauce that can be used on meat, fish, or vegetables)
Desserts (Verbena officinalis is sometimes used in dessert recipes such as crumbles, cobblers, and fruit salads for its sweet flavor and texture)
Marinades (verbena marinade is made by mixing the plant's leaves and flowers with olive oil, lemon juice, and herbs to create a flavorful marinade for meat or fish)
Vinegar (Verbena officinalis can be used to make a sweet and tangy vinegar by infusing its leaves and flowers in apple cider vinegar)
